answers.answer: If at the ultrasound they didn't hve concern about how low the baby was u should be fine. At my ultrasound my baby was low & pressing on my already short cervix. Under pressure my cervix went dwn 2 8mms. A normal cervix should measure at 30. I had 2 get a cerclage & now stuck on bed rest. I still feel my baby extremely low.I would ask next time u go what ur cervix is measuring at.
Yea it's normal. My son seems to like my lower right side a lot. They always find him there for ultrasounds :) and at times I feel really low kicks for whole days at a time..
Alrighty thanks ladies this helped.. I'll bring it up at my next appointment.

I am 30+4 and my daughter is very low! She's been low for a while too, I had an ultrasound at 27 weeks she was super low like her head was right in my left hip.. I had a 4D ultrasound at 29 weeks and she was still in the same spot, we couldn't get any really good pictures because she was so low.. I was diagnosed with gestational diabetes at 29 weeks also so yesterday I had an appointment 30+3 and dr wanted another ultrasound to check on my daughter and she was still around the same spot... he never said anything about it and I even mentioned it to him and he said some babies just like being low...

question: Had first ultrasound thru doctors office two weeks ago when I found out the gender. He was rlly low that day and ever since I started feeling him move.. He still seems to be down low.. Where he was during the ultrasound. He is the size of a banana. Dont have another appt til 2 weeks. Is it normal for baby to seem like he hasn't move his spot where I always feel the tiny movement down low??
